SENT.plain: A peptide prepared from purified factor 13B (F13B) was sequenced, and a single, long oligonucleotide corresponding to its cognate DNA sequence was constructed and used to screen a chromosome 7 specific genomic library
The positive clone isolated, designated pKV13, was only related to F13B at the oligonucleotide region, but has proved to be a valuable chromosome 7 marker
pKV13 maps to 7pter-q22 in hybrid cell lines, and is present in a chromosome-mediated gene transfer (CMGT) cell line that also contains met and other 7q probes

pKV13 defines a common MspI restriction fragment length polymorphism (RFLP), and is genetically linked to two markers on the long arm of chromosome 7, B79a and COLIA2, both themselves linked to the cystic fibrosis locus
Multipoint linkage analysis demonstrates that KV13 maps centromeric to both B79a and COLIA2
pKV13 has been used to demonstrate the existence of rearrangements within CMGT hybrids, and will also prove valuable in multipoint linkage studies of other 7q markers
Finally, pKV13 provides a new polymorphic locus for the characterisation of 7q deletions in myeloid disorders such as myelodysplastic syndrome
